preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 1. The metabolomics dataset and its associated meta-data if available (see section 4.1).
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 1. The metabolomics dataset and its associated meta-data if available (see section 4.1).

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 2. The defined objectives of the process.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 2. The defined objectives of the process.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 3. The aims of the metabolomics study.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 3. The aims of the metabolomics study.

externalSourcesList.description: Scott, I. M., C. P. Vermeer, et al. (2010). "Enhancement of Plant Metabolite Fingerprinting by Machine Learning." Plant Physiology 153(4): 1506-1520.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 4. The design of the metabolomics study and the assay which was used for acquiring the data. This must includes details regarding the bio-sample and sampling protocols, as well as sample preparation procedures and data acquisition including any pre-processing procedures already performed on the level of the assay.
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 4. The design of the metabolomics study and the assay which was used for acquiring the data. This must includes details regarding the bio-sample and sampling protocols, as well as sample preparation procedures and data acquisition including any pre-processing procedures already performed on the level of the assay.

externalSourcesList.description: Scott, I. M., C. P. Vermeer, et al. (2010). "Enhancement of Plant Metabolite Fingerprinting by Machine Learning." Plant Physiology 153(4): 1506-1520.

preRequisitesList.presetDescription: 5. Background knowledge/Information regarding metabolomics in general (see chapter 2), metabolic approaches (see section 2.5), design of metabolomics study (see section 2.6), data acquisition techniques (see section 2.6.5) and data pre-processing procedures in general (see section 4.1).
preRequisitesList.customisedDescription: 5. Background knowledge/Information regarding metabolomics in general (see chapter 2), metabolic approaches (see section 2.5), design of metabolomics study (see section 2.6), data acquisition techniques (see section 2.6.5) and data pre-processing procedures in general (see section 4.1).

externalSourcesList.description: BaniMustafa, A. (2012). A Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining Process Model for Metabolomics. PhD, University of Wales, Aberystwyth.
